'''Long Table''' is a castle in [[the Reach]], the region controlled by [[House Tyrell]] of [[Highgarden]]. The castle is located at the meeting of the [[Mander]] and the [[Blueburn]] rivers.<ref>[http://viewers-guide.hbo.com/game-of-thrones/season1/#!/locations/highgarden/ HBO viewers guide, season 1 map, Highgarden entry]</ref>
sections.In the books: In ''[[A Song of Ice and Fire]]'', Long Table is spelled "Longtable". It is the seat of House Merryweather. House Merryweather are notable for providing one of the [[Hand of the King|Hands of the King]] under [[Aerys II Targaryen]], the Mad King, after [[Tywin Lannister]]'s resignation. Lord Owen Merryweather was the Hand until the early stages of [[Robert's Rebellion]], which he did not take seriously. For his laxity, Aerys stripped him of his lands and sent him into exile, replacing him with Lord Jon Connington of [[Griffin's Roost]]. After taking the [[Iron Throne]], [[Robert Baratheon]] restored some of the lands to Owen's heirs, including Longtable. The current lord of the house, Orton, is married to the Lady Taena of the [[Free City]] of [[Myr]].
